page.title: 02Llandgywydd Church
page.content: St Tygwydd's church is Llandygwyd is protestant, church of Wales, in the diocese of St David's. It used to have its own Vicar but now shares a Vicar with four other churches in three parishes ad he takes four services each Sunday. Most of the people's first language is Welsh so half the services are in Welsh ad half in English. Most people in the are are Protestant, few are Roman Catholics. In St Tygwydd's church there are sixty seven members, but only about forty attend church on a regular basis. Some people attend non-conformist chapels the principal being the congregationalist. The church building needs constant mainenance and in the past ten years the tower has had to be removed. Â£1200 was spent recently on renewing the lead in the staing glass windows.
